element.name: Any Return of Spontaneous Circulation
element.definition: Indication whether or not there was any return of spontaneous circulation.
element.v3Comment:
This element is a component of the Utstein Cardiac Arrest Criteria as identified in the American Heart Association journal "Resuscitation" from 2004 entitled "Cardiac Arrest and Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation Outcome Reports". http://circ.ahajournals.org/cgi/content/full/110/21/3385
This element needs to be documented when the patient has been in cardiac arrest and transported to a healthcare facility to show the change in patient condition, if any.
Any ROSC is defined as any brief (approximately >30 seconds) restoration of spontaneous circulation that provides evidence of more than an occasional gasp, occasional fleeting palpable pulse, or arterial waveform.

facet.name: enumeration
facet.annotation: Yes, At Arrival at the ED

facet.name: enumeration
facet.annotation: Yes, Prior to Arrival at the ED

asserts.assert: Any Return of Spontaneous Circulation should only be recorded when Cardiac Arrest is "Yes...".
When Any Return of Spontaneous Circulation is "No", no other value should be recorded.
When Any Return of Spontaneous Circulation has a Not Value (Not Applicable, Not Recorded, or Not Reporting), it should be empty.

When Any Return of Spontaneous Circulation is empty, it should have a Not Value (Not Applicable, Not Recorded, or Not Reporting, if allowed for the element) or a Pertinent Negative (if allowed for the element), or it should be omitted (if the element is optional).
When Any Return of Spontaneous Circulation has a Not Value, no other value should be recorded.
